name: 9-Phenanthrenecarboxylic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4311

name: 9-Phenanthrenecarboxylic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4311
Reason: The target compound, 9-Phenanthrenecarboxylic acid, is composed of a phenanthrene core and a carboxylic acid group. Phenanthrene, the basic unit, has a melting point around 101°C. The carboxylic acid group typically introduces hydrogen bonding which can significantly increase the melting point, and this can be estimated as a +150°C increment. Moreover, the rigid polycyclic structure of phenanthrene contributes to a higher melting point due to the increased stability and reduced molecular motion, adding approximately another +2°C.
